intro: Rhodiola kirilowii var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved rhodiola, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its hardy nature and ability to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticultural and medicinal research.
